value: The funerary stelae often appear thermally altered on the side in contact with the ground, indicating that they were toppled during a fire in the area. This apparent destruction, resulting from the Roman presence, likely occurred at the end of the 2nd century or the beginning of the 1st century BC. Later, some of these fallen stelae were used to build a breakwater to prevent flooding from the Arroyo de La Vega.
